name: inappreciably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is too small to be noticed or to have an important effect: The changes would affect, perhaps inappreciably, the entire flora and fauna of the region. The two sets of results differed inappreciably from each other.
More examplesFewer examplesThe values of the village community differed inappreciably from those of the urban community. The method is applicable to phenomena which change inappreciably during the time of exposure.The remaining parameters are affected inappreciably by this change.
